core.description: This xml strucure contains the main pieces of information to document in a dataset

dataset.description: Documentation related to dataset type, function, and interpretation.

attribute.description: A classification of data into broad categories of mechanisms. E.g., neighborhood economic activity, environmental readings, etc.
A classification of data format which has implications on how the data can be stored, processed, and interpreted. In essence, it defines the main population unit of interest for this data
Any entity that can be spatially defined as a geographic area, with either natural (physical) or administrative boundaries.
Any period of time: year, week, month, day, or bimonthly or quarterly periods, etc.
The name of the original organization that collected the data. The data may have been subsequently processed, but this captures the original data source.
The API from the original organization that collected the data.
Data file type: delimited (csv, xls) or GIS (gdb, shapefile).
Description of how the data was collected: Probability-based survey, direct measurements, modeled results, etc.
Area which the data spans (e.g., United States, Chicago)
An internal unique name without spaces for this data asset.
A link to a computational notebook that converts the source data into the final format. This includes cleaning, reformatting, and aggregating.
A description of any stipulations of how this data can be used.
The date at which the data was last updated.
The date the data was accessed.
The organization that processed the data into its current form; this can be the original organization or not.
Website / link to original data access point.
A description of any incompleteness in this dataset.
A description of any incorrect values in this dataset.
